quest.name: Never to Return
journal: Reading between the lines, you understand that somehow, miraculously, Giott has regained access to the Cabinet of Curiosity─though the volumes within have been of little help in ascertaining the nature of the Ronkan magic Lamitt pursued. Dwarven records, on the other hand, have apparently yielded a useful hint as to the whereabouts of Lamitt's sister at the time of her travels. Your compatriot gives no further details, instead inviting you to visit the dwarven village of Tomra to see for yourself.

You gain access to Tomra via the Ladder─which, judging by the dwarf's comportment upon your arrival, is as much a surprise to Giott as anyone. Before you can ask for more details as to the purpose of your visit, however, your overeager companion rushes off deeper into the village.

Upon locating Giott once again, you find the dwarf poised over the still form of a defeated sin eater, which allegedly attacked when released from nearby tunnels. As Giott explains, said tunnels once served as a quarantine of sorts for those dwarves afflicted with stoneblight─a highly contagious illness that would turn flesh to stone and, at the time, had no cure. You then experience another vision, which confirms that Lamitt did, in fact, eventually succeed in curing her sister and others with the sickness─only to find herself met with scorn and banished from the village for having dared to break her people's taboos. Ever calm in the face of adversity, Lamitt accepted her punishment over Ardbert's protestations. Removing her dwarven helm once and for all, she─joined by her erstwhile patients─left her home, never to return.

Though the helm obscures Giott's face, the dwarf's tone makes it clear that this latest revelation has come as something of a blow. Time to process the story you relayed may help─though you know all too well that the weight of some truths never quite leaves one's shoulders.

※The next role quest will be available from Giott upon reaching level 80 in any healer class.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “The View from Above.”

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: <gulp> <gulp> <gulp> <gulp> <gulp>

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: There you are! I need─<hic>─lesh mead. Yeah, you heard me...lesh! But...more ale. Much more. Wait...<hic>...you ain't the waitresh...

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Oh, I know you want to say something─but you won't. You think that'll just encourage me. Well, maybe that's what I want you to think! Or maybe...<gasp>...you know that's what I want you to think! All this time I thought I was annoying you, but actually...

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Nah, can't be. All of this rubbish about lost civilizations must be getting to me. I've read a dozen histories, and I still don't know nothing about that magic of Lamitt's.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: What I did find, though, is where she would've gone if she wanted to see her sister─and it's in Tomra.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: So what do you say? Come and visit my home! I'll be waiting for you when you get there.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: I may have forgotten to tell Forename how to get here. That's unfortunate. Come to think of it, I ain't sure shehe can get here. The tunnel's only for dwarves, and...

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Forename!? Where'd you come from?

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: So it was you folks that got the Ladder moving? Huh!

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: I can't believe you managed that─and didn't even tell me! Just when you think you know a person...

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, that's a joke. Anyhow, the place I want to show you is just over there. Follow me!

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Nothing to worry about! This monstrosity came flying at my face─rudely, I might add─when I unsealed the old tunnels. But everything's under control.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: As you can see, I gave it an old-fashioned dwarven decking.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A...dwarven decking?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Old tunnels?

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Sorry, I ain't at liberty to explain further. It's forbidden to reveal the secrets of the dwarven decking to outsiders. And anyway, I brought you here for something more important than that.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Yeah. They're the reason that I brought you here. Can't say I was expecting such a nasty welcome, but maybe I should've.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Let me explain. We don't use it no more, but before the Flood, dwarves lived in this place. Only the sick ones, mind.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: In those days, there was this illness called “stoneblight.” Turned your skin to stone, bit by bit, and it was just a matter of time─a few months, or a few years─until you were petrified completely.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: No one knew where it came from, but they did know that it was contagious. And so they...they locked them all up. Here, in the Blightwarrens. They needed to keep it from spreading, because there was no cure. Not back then...

dialogue.name: DWARVENCHIEF
dialogue.text: Lamitt! Was it not enough to leave without permission? Or to return unbidden, bringing these strangers into our home? You knew full well that entering the Blightwarrens is forbidden! How many of our traditions must you trample before you are satisfied!?

dialogue.name: DWARVENCHIEF
dialogue.text: If you so refuse to respect your heritage, you have no place here. As head of the council, I hereby banish you. You are no longer a dwarf. Begone, and never return!

dialogue.name: DWARVENWARRIOR
dialogue.text: (-Jeering Dwarves-)Begone!

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: Have you lost your wits!? Lamitt just cured your people! Her sister, and all the others. She left your village to find a way to save them, and she did─she did what no one else would!

dialogue.name: DWARVENCHIEF
dialogue.text: Your words have no weight here, outsider. This is a dwarven matter. Silence!

dialogue.name: DWARVENWARRIOR
dialogue.text: (-Jeering Dwarves-)Silence!

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: I will not be silent! You have no idea what we─what Lamitt has been through!

dialogue.name: LAMITT
dialogue.text: ...That's enough, Ardbert. Whatever my reasons, I did break our laws. And I did so knowing that this would be the result.

dialogue.name: LAMITT
dialogue.text: I will accept my punishment. I leave my dwarven pride behind today.

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: Lamitt─

dialogue.name: DWARVENSISTER
dialogue.text: If Lamitt is leaving, so am I.

dialogue.name: DWARVENSISTER
dialogue.text: You probably didn't think much of us after you shoved us in there to die, but it was awfully hard to breathe. We all took our helms off.

dialogue.name: DWARVENSISTER
dialogue.text: If Lamitt's going to be banished for breaking our traditions, then I should be too!

dialogue.name: DWARVENPATIENT
dialogue.text: As the young lady says─none of us is perfect. It ain't right that Lamitt should be the only one punished for it, especially seeing as she was saving us.

dialogue.name: DWARVENPATIENT
dialogue.text: Come on, exiles! We keep our faces plain for all to see, and our heads held high!

dialogue.name: LAMITT
dialogue.text: Oh, everyone...

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: Are you sure you're all right with this?

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: We could go back. We could...

dialogue.name: LAMITT
dialogue.text: What, pummel the elders with your axe? <sigh>

dialogue.name: LAMITT
dialogue.text: I know you're not that fledgling adventurer who got knocked flat by hobs anymore. You could probably defeat even our strongest warriors. But forget it.

dialogue.name: LAMITT
dialogue.text: We have more important things to worry about─we still haven't found what caused the illness in the first place. If it really is the Shadowkeeper again... Well, you know what we have to do.

dialogue.name: LAMITT
dialogue.text: If this is what it takes to save our world, I will give up my home and more, Ardbert.

dialogue.name: LAMITT
dialogue.text: And anyway, it's not all bad. I don't think I really understood, before. How beautiful it is out here. How nice the wind feels.

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: It is nice, isn't it?

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: And for what it's worth...I'm glad you're here. Helmet or no.

dialogue.name: LAMITT
dialogue.text: Ardbert...thank you.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Hey, hobdaughterson! Uh...ugly! <sigh> Look, I'm running out of insults here. And I'm starting to feel bad. Just wake up already.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Finally!

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Well, that was harrowing. About as soon as you started doing your thing, that sin eater decided to rise from the dead...

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Though I suppose that's mostly my own fault for not dealing it an extra blow or two just in case. Anyhow, what did you see?

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: I knew it! I knew that Lamitt was the one who cured stoneblight─it had to have been. She saved all of them. And they...they exiled her for it.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: And the...the head of the Council of Elders...

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Oh! Sorry, I...I suppose I wandered off. Got caught up in my own thoughts.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Actually, can you...give me a moment? Or maybe a while. I just... I'm not sure what to think, is all.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: I don't want to keep you from your other work, so... See you later.
